body.p: Born in Washington, Kentucky. Attended Transylvania University and graduated from West Point in 1826. Married Henrietta Preston in 1829. Fought in the Black Hawk War in 1832. Settled in Texas in 1836 and enlisted in the Texas army, fighting for independence from Mexico. Became the senior brigadier general and commander of the army in 1837. Became secretary of war for the Republic of Texas in 1838. Resigned two years later, returning to his farm in Brazoria County. Re-married Eliza Griffin in 1843. Colonel of a Texas division of volunteers under General Zachary Taylor during the Mexican War. Taylor appointed him paymaster of the U.S. Army in 1849. Assumed command of the 2d Cavalry Regiment under Lieutenant Colonel Robert E. Lee in 1855. Commanded the Department of Texas in 1856. Became a brevet brigadier general in 1859. Placed in command of the Department of the Pacific in 1861, but resigned that year when Texas seceded from the Union. During the Civil War, Jefferson Davis appointed him the second ranking full general for the Confederate army and in command of the Western Department. His son, William Preston Johnston, was a Confederate colonel and aide-de-camp to Jefferson Davis. General Albert Sidney Johnston launched a surprise assault on Ulysses S. Grant's encampment around Pittsburg Landing on the Tennessee River, beginning the Battle of Shiloh on April 6, 1862. Johnston was killed during that battle, after leading a charge.
